reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This vacuum is perfect for quick and effortless cleanups. Lightweight and easy to maneuver it has good suction and the head swivels easily. I don't use it on my stairs as the attachment isn't great with pet hair (I use my "big" vacuum for that chore). Such a handy tool to have for last minute simple tasks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome Little Vacuum
reviews.reviewText: This vacuum is amazing, it is so light weight my 2 1/2 twin boys take turns using it vs their toy one, (opinion their interest to help in that department continues lol) love the fact the filter is washable, super suction for just a little vacuum, and the attachments are easy to change up, the entire thing is great on the surfaces I have used it on which are carpet, hard wood & my microfiber style couch. (It does not have rollers on the main vacuum attachment it's like a little rubbery strip that works great for pushing things forward! Awesome purchase for price and what I was looking for! I was tiered of lugging my big vacuum up and down floors, same for my income vacuum system (honestly though I think this little vacuum works better then my in home vacuum system anyways)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Hepa filter fills up quickly.
reviews.reviewText: This is a wonderful little vacuum and I especially like the ability to use the handheld part. I have a cat so I can easily vacuum the furniture. It has great suction and it’s easy to manipulate going around corners, etc. The only drawback is that Hepa filter has to be cleaned often as I have carpeting. I use a toothbrush to clean the hair in dust a few times as I’m using it and then I wash it from time to time. I will get one or two replacement filters when I can find them. However, it’s perfect for me because I can’t use a heavy vacuum. I definitely recommend it for my one bedroom apartment or for quick pick ups in a large house.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Kinda regret it.
reviews.reviewText: I got this for a few reasons:Easy to assemble, very lightweight, easy maneuverability, plug in so no waiting for charging, no brush roll so hair doesn't get tangled in it, dust cup and filter, multiple options for cleaning (dust buster etc), and of course the cheap price.How it ended up:It's a stick vaccuum so it's not for anything that requires strong suction such as thick carpeting which I unfortunately have. I think it's just barely too thick ugh. So when I use it, I have to really lean into it to make it suction better (I hope I achieve this anyway, otherwise I'm killing my back for nothing lol).The cord is very short lol. I can not reach the other ends of the bdrm or living room using the the same outlets in each room. I use a bdrm outlet for the bdrm and I have to plug it into another bdrm outlet for the rest of the bdrm, kind of a hassle! The bdrm is a bit long but geez it's not a mansion lol. It's a very basic 1 bdrm apt!The size is very small and easy to assemble, when I first opened the box, I was shocked how small the box was lol. Unfortunately mine doesn't stay upright on its own, so you do have to always have it leaning on something. To empty the dust cup, you basically have to disassemble part of it and then reassemble. That's annoying. And there isn't anything to attach the extra tool to on the vaccuum so it just sits freely near it lol.I could go on lol. Maybe I should have returned it but oh well. I didn't want to deal with that during the pandemic. It could be ideal for you if your home situation is different and better for it than mine is. I should have listened to warnings.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great, after a quick masking-tape upgrade
reviews.reviewText: At first I thought “Oh, I see. I’ve purchased the worst vacuum in the history of ever.”We have dogs and cats and a lot of hardwood floors, so we end up with tumbleweeds everywhere. I bought this as a quick cleanup tool that I could easily carry up and downstairs.But when I first turned it on, I realized that it has a basic design flaw: the vents blow air SIDEways, rather than straight back, so the second I started cleaning, the tumbleweeds went flying AWAY from the vacuum. Which is sort of the opposite of what you want.Then I remembered a hack I’d seen on another hand vac with the same problem, tried it... and all is forgiven! Best little vac ever.Here’s my version of the solution, using paper painter’s tape (it’s usually bright blue — no clue why this one is green.) Wide masking tape would do as well. Fold a strip of tape in half with the sticky sides together. Then use another strip of tape to attach the first strip just below the vents. Voila! Even that short a spoiler works to redirect the air flow, and we’re in business.Solid motor, great suction, the free-standing feature is handier than you might think, the swivel head works really well, and this has a cord, so you’re not at the mercy of recharging. If you’ve got lots of pet hair around, you’ll find that the bin needs emptying pretty frequently. I have a feeling I’ll need to replace the filter pretty soon, but I can baby it a while by washing it out. All in all, a great product — once you retrofit the spoilers.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wow I didn’t guess this little boy will be much stronger than I thought, I like it it’s my favorite
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded.

It's nice that it has a washable filter, but it does say that it should be replaced every 6 to 9 months. This is why I gave it a four star........I cannot find a replacement filter. I checked everywhere online, but haven't found any. Very disappointing, as this is a great brand, and I had the cordless one before this one. Needed one that lasted longer while vacuuming.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't pick up dirt like I had hoped

reviews.reviewText: Ideal para la limpieza diaria es compacta y tiene buena potencia, ideal para recolectar migajas de comida, pelos y polvo, tengo un niño de 2 años y me es muy util para limpiar el piso despues de que come.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excelente para polvo, mala para basuritas
reviews.reviewText: Estoy contenta con la aspiradora porque es muy buena levantando polvo, pelos y cabellos del suelo, más no para levantar pedacitos de papel, cartón, plantas o cualquier basura de aproximadamente un centímetro porque se queda atorada en una compuerta plástica diseñada para que la basura no se regrese. NO aspiren Unicel porque se atora en el filtro y es difícil de quitar. En la Ciudad de México siempre hay mucho polvo, así que con tantito que aspire se ensucia mucho el filtro, y para no forzar la máquina lo limpio frecuentemente así que nunca he estado cerca de llenar el gran depósito para basura que tiene.Algo que me había llamado mucho la atención de este modelo es que tiene un filtro lavable y pensé que no necesitaría reemplazarlo, pero resulta que el fabricante sugiere hacer el cambio cada 6 ó 9 meses y no he encontrado dónde conseguirlos. Adjunto fotos del filtro por si eso ayuda a alguien a encontrar un reemplazo de otra marca. Me gustó que es muy liviana (aprox 1.6 kilos con la barra metálica y el accesorio grande) y porque es fácil de sacudir el filtro aunque es un poco ruidosa como cualquier otra de este tamaño por lo que sugiero usar protección auditiva y usarla lejos de las mascotas . Ellos sugieren que se use el cepillo accesorio, pero lo desaconsejo porque se le queda atrapada la basura en sus cerdas y mejor sugiero usar un cepillo dental de cerdas suaves.Originalmente la compré para recoger los pelos de gato de los muebles, pero no la uso para eso porque el cepillo se ensucia mucho y hay que pasarla varias veces para que levante todo el pelo. Para recoger el pelo recomiendo totalmente este rodillo https://www.amazon.com.mx/gp/aw/d/B087WWQXQR?psc=1&ref=ppx_pop_mob_b_asin_title que es súper eficiente levantaándolo.El accesorio de plástico que es como una extensión es bueno para la limpieza de ventanas, pero resultó muy inútil para limpiar entre los asientos del coche o entre muebles porque es demasiado corto y termina chocando el cuerpo de la aspiradora.Luego de aproximaba un año de uso ocasional de rompieron unas pestañas del accesorio para aspirar el piso. La función de dichas pestañas era permitir que el cabezal girara libremente para así permanecer pegado al piso al aspirar bajo los muebles. Sin las pestañas el accesorio no se detiene y se cae al piso. Lo solucioné enredando cinta teflón (la que se usa para la cuerda de piezas de tubería de agua) en la pieza que perdió las pestañas y con eso ya no se cae el cabezal y puedo aspirar normalmenteHecha en ChinaConsumo eléctrico 4A (480W)Voltaje AC 120V
